intro: Perdicium havanense, commonly known as the Cuban spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, branched stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces yellowish-green cyathia, which are specialized floral structures typical of the spurge family. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Perdicium havanense is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant.
